item.source: Razer Blade - Worlds First True Gaming Laptop

item.title: Razer Blade - Worlds First True Gaming Laptop
item.dc:creator: Luciel
item.description:
To give a more modern view on components you can get for 2800 usd…

ASUS Maximus IV
Intel i7 2600k
OCZ SSD 120Gb
2x 3Tb Seagate Barracuda HDD
CD/DVD Rewriter
2x GTX570 1Gb
16Gb DDR3 1600Mhz by Corsair
Cooler Master HAF case
Liquid Cooling for CPU, and if you cut down on mobo, something like the asus sabertooth, you can prob get liquid cooling for gpus aswell for example, EK liquid cooling blocks.
22" LED Screen

Alternativly you can cut down on the hard drives, if you dont need 6Tb (lol) (keeping the ssd for performance), get a 1Tb hard drive, buy a cheaper corsair or Cooler Master case (or case of your liking, but since this system needs serious cooling…) and get 2 more screens and have triplehead system : )

… yeah I wont be getting that laptop…lol

Read full topic

item.title: Razer Blade - Worlds First True Gaming Laptop
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
jerry:

pic
bscly

I like how they magically got an Xbox 360 in there, too.

I wouldn’t touch this shit personally. Laptops are fine for web browsing and some casual stuff IMO, but they’re no good for real games. Even if they’re powerful enough, there are too many more things that can go wrong with a laptop compared to a desktop.
